alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 04 at 2:37AM PST until February 05 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches, except 1 to 2 feet west of Highway 395. Wind gusts of 45 to 60 mph, with gusts up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Tree limbs could be blown down by the strong winds, producing a few power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 10 to 15% chance for thunder near the Sierra crest late tonight and early Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
